means: 达到（认识、理解或相信的程度）

sentence.Network_en: Most of my patients welcome the coming of summer.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的大部分病人盼望着夏天的到来。

sentence.Network_en: I heard them coming, crashing through the undergrowth, before I saw them.
sentence.Network_cn: 还没看到他们，我便听到他们穿过矮树丛过来的声音。

sentence.Network_en: He keeps coming to the aid of this damsel in distress.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不断出手相助这位落难女子。

phrase.cizu_name: coming and going (或 comings and goings)

jx.jx_en_mean: the busy, active movements of a person or group of people, especially in and out of a place
jx.jx_cn_mean: 来来往往，进进出出，忙忙碌碌

phrase.cizu_name: not know if one is coming or going

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)be confused, especially as a result of being very busy

entry.tran: (事件或时间)即将到来的，即将发生的
entry.def: A coming event or time is an event or time that will happen soon.

example.ex: This obviously depends on the weather in the coming months...
example.tran: 这显然取决于未来几个月的天气。

example.ex: They talk of the coming battle.
example.tran: 他们谈论着即将到来的战斗。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of drawing spatially closer to something;
2. arrival that has been awaited (especially of something momentous);
3. the temporal property of becoming nearer in time;
4. the moment of most intense pleasure in sexual intercourse

auth_sentence.content: I remember coming to watch that as a kid.

auth_sentence.content: So a second coming of the album is important.
auth_sentence.res_content: So a second coming of the album is important.

Sentence.sentence: The company just released an updated version last week, and it'll be utilized in over 50 undergraduate and graduate classrooms this coming school year.
Thank you very much for coming this afternoon.
But by senior year, two-thirds have moved up to physics," says Gilbert "Our kids are coming to school in part because they know there are adults here who know them and care for them.

It is estimated that 25% of all methane that released into the atmosphere coming from farm animals.
About 70% of this is consumed by the global agriculture sector, and the level of use will continue to rise over the coming decades.

sentences.en: Everyone rightly feared the coming war.
sentences.cn: 人人都担心战争即将爆发，这是理所当然的。

means.word_mean: 将要遭到报应；自食恶果

sentences.en: He’s got a shock coming to him when he takes the exams and sees how difficult they are.
sentences.cn: 他看到考试那么难时吓了一跳，他这是自食其果。

sentences.en: He thinks he can break all the rules; but, believe me, he’s got it coming to him one day.
sentences.cn: 他不把规矩放在眼里，可是，走着瞧，早晚他会自食恶果。

means.word_mean: 用意所在；说此番话的原因(指由说话人的观念、信仰或个性等所造成)

sentences.en: I see where you’re coming from.
Half the pleasure of coming home is finding out what’s been happening while you were away.
sentences.cn: 回家的一大乐事在于发现自己不在时家里发生了什么事情。
